ygData.subject: Re: All right, I'm in...
ygData.msgSnippet: Get yourself a caster friend who can cast invis on you, then give the wines over to the guy. He was killing Ratraz as well...but with me invising him, and him
ygData.messageBody:
Get yourself a caster friend who can cast invis on you, then give the wines
over to the guy. He was killing Ratraz as well...but with me invising him,
and him giving the red wines over, he got his faction up again.

Lanadina


----Original Message Follows----
From: Chris Drew <xcdrewx@...>
Reply-To: EQ-Quest@onelist.com
To: EQ-Quest@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ-Quest] All right, I'm in...
Date: Thu, 17 Feb 2000 17:04:57 -0800 (PST)

Speaking of faction problems.

I am a Dark ELf in Neriak who cannot buy/seel to any
merchants. I killed Ratraz to many times. I was told
to give red wine to some guy, but since my faction is
already so low, he won't help me...
any ideas?

Also I got an Ogre friend that killed to many Dark
Elves in duels and now isn't allowed past the first
zone in Neriak...
any ideas?


Later
Chris

Dharkness
Vallon zek


--- Aaron Braunstein <aaron_spam@...> wrote:
> Well, let's see what I can contribute to this here
> list and
> see what happens.
> Some time ago, I had a friend who screwed up and
> became KOS
> in Freeport. I looked all over in an effort to find
> something that
> would help his faction and came up with donuts. I
> remember that one
> of the things that was suggested was to go to HH
> Pass and kill Orcs,
> for that would help his faction. At the time, this
> did not seem to
> do the trick.
> Well, I don't know if my friend just didn't know
> what to do,
> didn't do it enough, or if the thing just didn't
> work then, but I can
> now say for sure that killing both HH orcs and HH
> gnolls will help,
> but the BIG payoff is running their scalps to the
> local guard
> captains. Give them a single scalp and you will get
> exp as well as
> faction gains for several different hard to modify
> groups - including
> the Freeport Militia. The beauty of this one is
> that there are no
> faction losses, as are most of the other +Militia
> quests of which I
> know. You also get between 1 and 6 gold pieces for
> doing this, so
> it's good for a reasonable chunk of change as well.
> I turned in
> about 25 of the scalps and went from apprehensive to
> indifferent.
> --
> Aaron Braunstein
> Pacific Data Management, Inc.
> (408)283-5900 xt. 28
> <aaron_braunstein@...>
>
